projects.title: QuizMaster
description: Software Systems Capstone Project at Lewis University.
Designed, as part of an Agile Scrum team, a comprehensive quizzing application to keep users' minds sharp on various topics.
Redesigned and modernized the front-end application from HTML/CSS/JavaScript to React and Tailwind CSS, optimizing the user experience.
Onboarded and mentored Juniors to develop new features and take over maintenance, ensuring project continuity.

projects.title: Personal Blog
description: A modern personal blog built with Astro, featuring a clean dark theme and responsive design.
The blog includes code syntax highlighting, LaTeX math support, and a tag-based organization system.
Content is managed through TinaCMS and deployed on Vercel. This serves as a platform for sharing my thoughts on movies, music, coding, and technology.

projects.title: An Agent-Based Model of Environmental Transmission of Clostridioides difficile in Healthcare Settings
description: The Research project started in June 2022. This is an Agent-Based model of C. difficile developed in NetLogo.
The model tracks the spread of C. difficile in healthcare settings keeping track of the infection pathways.
The research was conducted with a partner and two faculty advisors.
I have presented the research at various mathematics conferences around the country.
I have won The Janet L. Andersen Award,
Outstanding Poster Award at MathFest, Outstanding Undergraduate Research from ISMAA, and a finalist for the
Dr. Stephany Schlachter Excellence in Undergraduate Scholarship Award; forthcoming publication in the Journal of Mathematical Biology, 2025.
